pageContext.claim: “Take Comey. Everybody hated Comey. They thought he did a horrible job. The Democrats hated him. They were calling for his resignation. They were going for his firing, including Schumer, including Nancy Pelosi, until I fired him, and once I fired him, everybody said: oh, why did you fire him? Why did you fire him?”
pageContext.analysis: Democrats such as Rep. Nancy Pelosi and Sen. Charles Schumer certainly had soured on FBI Director James Comey because of his handling of the Hillary Clinton email controversy, especially his decision to reopen the investigation ten days before the election. Schumer had said he lost confidence in Comey and Pelosi said "maybe he's not in the right job." But the circumstances of Comey's firing appeared suspicious and unrelated to the Clinton matter. Democrats especially expressed concern over the effect Comey’s firing could have on an investigation into Russia’s interference in the election that he oversaw
